CN.content:
Please identify the "Material Name" entities in the following paragraph. Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Material Name". Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Paragraph: For unipolar transport in a trap - free semiconductor with an ohmic injecting contact , the SCLC can be approximated by the Mott - Gurney equation : ε ε μ γ ≅ ⎛ ⎝ ⎜ ⎞ ⎠ ⎟ J V L V L 9^8 exp 0.891 r 0^0 2^3 ( 3 ) Here J is the current density , ε r is the dielectric constant of the polymer , ε 0 is the free - space permittivity ( 8.85 × 10^-12 F / m ) , μ 0 is the charge mobility at zero field , γ is a constant , L is the thickness of the blended film layer , V = V appl - V bi , V appl is the applied potential , and V bi is the built-in potential which results from the difference in the work function of the anode and the cathode ( in this device structure , V bi = 0.2 V ).

Let's think step by step.

| Material Name |
| --- |
| polymer |
| anode |
| cathode |

Explanation:

The material names identified in the given paragraph are "polymer", "anode", and "cathode". These terms are mentioned as materials or components of the device structure being discussed.

Please remove entities that do not clearly refer to "Material name" and present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Material Name".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

| Material Name |
| --- |
| polymer |

Explanation:

After re-evaluating the given paragraph, only the term "polymer" is identified as a clear "Material Name". The terms "anode" and "cathode" are not explicitly mentioned as specific materials in the paragraph. They are referred to as components of the device structure, but their specific materials are not specified. Therefore, only "polymer" is included in the table.

Paragraph: For unipolar transport in a trap - free semiconductor with an ohmic injecting contact , the SCLC can be approximated by the Mott - Gurney equation : ε ε μ γ ≅ ⎛ ⎝ ⎜ ⎞ ⎠ ⎟ J V L V L 9^8 exp 0.891 r 0^0 2^3 ( 3 ) Here J is the current density , ε r is the dielectric constant of the polymer , ε 0 is the free - space permittivity ( 8.85 × 10^-12 F / m ) , μ 0 is the charge mobility at zero field , γ is a constant , L is the thickness of the blended film layer , V = V appl - V bi , V appl is the applied potential , and V bi is the built-in potential which results from the difference in the work function of the anode and the cathode ( in this device structure , V bi = 0.2 V ).

| --- |
| J (current density) |
| ε\_r (dielectric constant of the polymer) |
| ε\_0 (free - space permittivity, 8.85 × 10^-12 F / m) |
| μ\_0 (charge mobility at zero field) |
| γ (a constant) |
| L (thickness of the blended film layer) |
| V (V = V appl - V bi) |
